projects.name: OESE SharePoint Sites
projects.organization: Office of Elementary and Secondary Education
projects.description: The OESE SharePoint Project provides a centralized knowledge management system and portal to improve internal communication within OESE, provides OESE staff access to the right information when they need it, and enables collaboration among OESE staff.  The OESE SharePoint portal contains an organized, centralized and searchable repository of OESE-specific information that is not currently available elsewhere.  Items currently available on-line include leading indicators, OESE’s logic model toolkit, performance data, process maps, and information on internal OESE processes (e.g., standard operating procedures, templates, checklists, examples, best practices).

projects.name: RESULTS: Interstate and Intrastate coordination website
projects.organization: Office of Elementary and Secondary Education
projects.description: An online resource to improve the inter- and intra-state coordinate of MEP granted

projects.name: Migrant Student Information Exchange (MSIX)
projects.organization: Office of Elementary and Secondary Education
projects.description: The Migrant Student Information Exchange (MSIX) is the technology that allows States to share educational and health information on migrant children who travel from State to State and who as a result, have student records in multiple States' information systems.

projects.name: Alternative Dispute Resolution Case Tracking System (MicroPact)
projects.description: A case tracking system  that provides the Department of Education with integrated reports and real time statistical data on informal pre-grievances, formal and informal EEO pre-complaints and formal complaints that aid in the development of strategies to prevent and address workplace disputes
projects.license: Available in the OM Progrm Office

projects.name: Office of Hearing and Appeals (OHA) Case Tracking and Reporting System (MicroPact)
projects.description: A docket management case tracking system that assists the Department of Education’s OHA in the compliance and adjudication of administrative hearings before OHA’s tribunal body.
projects.license: Available in the OM Progrm Office

projects.name: Parking Case Tracking System (MicroPact)
projects.description: A case tracking systems that has includes a parking application that is approved/disapproved online and generates reports.
projects.license: Available in the OM Program Office

projects.name: Federal Real Property Division (FRPD) Tracking System(MicroPact)
projects.description: The FRPD is a web-based system designed to track the 30-year life cycle of surplus properties disposed of by the General Services Administration and the Department of Defense for educational purposes. The properties are managed by the U.S. Department of Education.
projects.license: Available in the OM Program Office

projects.name: Labor and Employee Relations Branch Case Tracking System (MicroPact)
projects.description: A case tracking system used by the U.S. Department of Education to track, report and retrieve  labor and employee relations cases and related documents.
projects.license: Available in the OM Program Office

projects.name: Telework Agreement Form Workflow  (SharePoint)
projects.description: A SharePoint workflow that allows the submission, evaluation, approval and/or disapproval of new Telework requests; the termination of existing Telework Agreement; and to review the status of Draft, Submitted, Approved, Disapproved or Terminated Telework Agreements.
projects.license: Available in the OM Program Office

projects.name: Tuition Reimbursement Program Form Workflow   (SharePoint)
projects.description: An automated SharePoint workflow that allows U.S. Department of Education employees an opportunity to submit an application to receive tuition reimbursement for undergraduate or graduate courses at a college or university of their choice.  The documentation is used by a Panel Review Team to rate and approve the applications that are retained in the system.
projects.license: Available in the OM Program Office

projects.name: Exit Clearance Form Workflow   (SharePoint)
projects.description: An automated SharePoint workflow that allows employees who are separating or transferring from the U.S. Department of Education to initiate, obtain, and document form.
projects.license: Available in the OM Program Office

projects.name: Budget Formulation Database
projects.organization: Office of Planning, Evaluation, and Policy Development
projects.description: The Budget Formulation Database is used to assist in formulating the Department's Salaries and Expenses budget requests to OMB and Congress.

projects.name: Teacher Shortage Areas Nationwide Listing
projects.description: A State that desires to propose teacher shortage areas for designation must submit the information required under the program regulations

projects.name: National Report System (NRS) Adult Ed Web-Based Data Collection and Warehousing
projects.organization: Office of Career, Technical, and Adult Education
projects.description: Section 212 of Adult Education and Family Literacy Act, requires that ED establish a comprehensive performance accountability system for formula grantees to assess the effectiveness of adult education and literacy activities. NRS is the required system.

projects.name: Literacy Information and Communications System
projects.organization: Office of Career, Technical, and Adult Education
projects.description: LINCS is a professional learning platform for adult educators.

projects.name: Financial Aid Toolkit
projects.description: The Financial Aid Toolkit (FinancialAidToolkit.ed.gov) provides important information and resources for middle school and high school counselors, TRIO and GEAR UP staff, college access professionals, and other professionals who work with and advise students and families on preparing for and funding a postsecondary education.

projects.name: ADG Applications (ADGA)
projects.description: The ADG Applications investment covers operations for 7 applictions. It was downgraded in FY14 to non-major status due to DME funding cuts by the FSA IRB.  The BY2015 submission represents a revision to the investment that now includes DME.

projects.name: Aid Data Mart (ADM)
projects.description: The Aid Data Mart gathers summary and detail lending data  from FMS, NSLDS, and PEPS, and makes it available in both predefined reports and ad hoc inquiry formats to be used in program management and oversight activities.  It is scheduled to be decommissioned on 01/15/2017 as its functionality has been developed in the EDWA IT investment.

projects.name: Application and Eligibility Determination System (AEDS)
projects.description: The AEDS supports a large group of front end business functions associated with applying for federal student aid. The primary business function is application processing and eligibility determination.

projects.name: Common Origination and Disbursement (COD)
projects.description: Common processing platform for Federal student aid recipients at higher education institutions participating in Title IV aid programs to originate and disburse Title IV funds, including Pell Grants & Direct Loans. EDWA project added in FY14.

projects.name: Debt Management and Collections System (DMCS)
projects.description: The DMCS Investment supports a system that collects defaulted student debt through a number of means and returns the money to the Treasury.

projects.name: eCampus Based System
projects.description: The investment (eCampus-Based System) supports the activities that provide Campus-Based funds (Federal Supplemental Educational Opportunity Grant, Federal Work-Study, and Federal Perkins Loans) to Title IV eligible institutions.

projects.name: EDExpress
projects.description: EDE Suite is a suite of two free software products (EDExpress and Direct Loan Tools) provided by FSA to schools for their use in originating, disbursing, and packaging Title IV aid for students.

projects.name: Enterprise Business Collaboration (EBC)
projects.description: EBC provides the Department of Education a platform where users (employees, contractors, external partners) can collaborate with each other using SharePoint, Office Communication Suite (chat) and LiveMeeting.

projects.name: Enterprise Data Warehouse and Analytics (EDWA)
projects.description: The EDWA project will provide a mechanism to collect and report on all aspects of the origination and disbursement process.

projects.name: Enterprise Identity Management Service (EIMS)
projects.description: The Enterprise Identity Management Service will provide a centralized and consolidated identity management framework for FSA  systems.

projects.name: eZ-Audit
projects.description: eZ-Audit is a web-based application that provides a single point of submission to electronically collect financial statements and compliance audits from schools, and facilitates the processing of these through the School Eligibility Channel (SEC).

projects.name: Federal Student Aid Financial Management System (FSA FMS)
projects.description: Utilizing Oracle Federal Financials, FMS is the single point of financial information by institution, integrating transactions both from the FSA feeder systems as well as from the G5 system.

projects.name: FSA Portals (IFAPandSchoolsPortion)
projects.description: The Information for Financial Aid Professionals (IFAP) web site serves as FSA's electronic library for financial aid professionals. IFAP also provides FSA's constituency with a single point of access to all FSA web sites which they may need in a day.

projects.name: Health Education Assistance Loans (HEAL)
projects.description: This investment is a unique web based system with an Oracle database that tracks current payment status on outstanding HEAL loans and enables the HEAL Program to project the government s potential liability for future claim payments.

projects.name: Integrated Partner Management (IPM)
projects.description: The IPM initiative, through process reengineering and process automation, will provide, in one solution, improved eligibility, enrollment, and oversight processes used to manage partner entities as they administer Title IV Financial Aid for Students.

projects.name: Integrated Student Experience (ISE)
projects.description: The Integrated Student Experience initiative is comprised of student websites, new media and mobile interfaces.  The project will begin to consolidate FSA s 14+ websites for students, rewrite content into plain language, and improve customer experience.

projects.name: National Student Loan Database System (NSLDS)
projects.description: The NSLDS Investment is a mixed-life cycle investment that accounts for the current operations and maintenance of an application that manages integration of enrollment, loan, grant and student data used for eligibility determination, PM & Oversight.

projects.name: Ombudsman Case Tracking System and Coalition of Federal Ombudsman Website (OCTS)
projects.description: This project continues maintenance and operations support for the Ombudsman Case Tracking System (OCTS) and the Coalition of Federal Ombudsmen Website (CFOW) accessible at https://octs.ed.gov/ and http://federalombuds.ed.gov/, respectively.  In addition this investment supports the new FSA Feedback system (formerly known as the Enterprise Complaint Systen) called for by President Barak Obama.

projects.name: Postsecondary Education Participants System (PEPS)
projects.description: The Postsecondary Education Participants System (PEPS) is the repository of data for entities participating in the Title IV Programs i.e schools, lenders, guarantors.

projects.name: Student Aid Internet Gateway (SAIG)
projects.description: The purpose of the project is to ensure continuing comprehensive, effective operational and maintenance support for SAIG.  SAIG provides telecommunications support and facilitates data transmission to Federal Student Aid (FSA) customers.

projects.name: ED Web Support Services
projects.organization: Office of the Chief Information Officer
projects.description: ED.gov is the Department's primary Internet portal and website.  The ED Web Support Services project supports the ED.gov application.

projects.name: Open Source Search
projects.organization: Office of the Chief Information Officer
projects.description: An open source tool based on Apache SOLR that provides enterprise search capabilities for ed.gov, and replaces the outdated Google Search Applicance

projects.name: CPSS – Contracts Purchasing and Support System
projects.organization: Office of the Chief Information Officer
projects.description: System of Record for contract writing activities across the Department

projects.name: ELVIS (on AEM's server)
projects.description: This is a temporary system designed to develop ERIC records. It ingests various sources of publisher information, has a workflow system, and publishes XML to be ingested in ERIC

projects.name: ELVIS (in IES Data Center)
projects.description: This is a temporary system designed to develop ERIC records. It ingests various sources of publisher information, has a workflow system, and publishes XML to be ingested in ERIC

projects.name: ERIC Database
projects.description: This is a database of 1.6 million bibliographic citations and full text documents. It is available at eric.ed.gov

projects.name: ERIC Processing System
projects.description: This system takes records sent by the old ELVIS system and processes them to run in the ERIC Database

projects.name: Find What Works
projects.description: This is a webiste application that takes information about studies reviewed and sorts them in an easily customizable format

projects.name: Reviewed Studies Database
projects.description: This is a database of all studies reviewed by the WWC

projects.name: Online Courses
projects.description: This is an application to allow users to complete their training online. It includes videos, an online test, and a certification

projects.name: Online Study Review Guide
projects.description: This is an internal processing system to cooridnate reviewes for the What Works Clearinghouse.

projects.name: RCT Yes
projects.description: RCT-YES is a free software tool that allows you to easily analyze data and report results on the effectiveness of programs in your context.

projects.name: EdMaps
projects.description: REL Midwest EdMaps is a Web-mapping application that displays complex education data geographically as "story maps." EdMaps helps users analyze publicly available school- and district-level data, observe trends over time, and frame conversations on practice and policy.

projects.name: The Program, Outcomes, Measures and Targets Application (POMT)
projects.description: Program, Outcomes, Measures and Targets Application (POMT) helps users create a plan to monitor, measure, and track outcomes over time to evaluate program effectiveness.

projects.name: The Education Logic Model (ELM) application
projects.description: The Education Logic Model (ELM) application helps users create a logic model and the Program
